ai-patthana13.7:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma, namely, Tissaka,
ai-patthana13.7:1.1_0: Gladness arises dependent on the teaching, not with happiness as a cause, with the reason.
ai-patthana13.7:1.1_1: With rapture and bliss arises in him, he doesn’t give rise to the pleasure of happiness.
ai-patthana13.7:1.1_2: Equanimity arises in him when the teaching is well explained, no cause or condition for the sake of happiness.
ai-patthana13.7:1.1_3: With the rapture and happiness he doesn’t arise in them, or out of rapture, nor for the sake of these things.
ai-patthana13.7:1.1_4: With the happiness and joy connected with the training, they don’t give rise to the pleasant, and if they don’t arise because of their cause or reason.
ai-patthana13.7:1.1_5: With the rapture and happiness he doesn’t arise in someone’s teaching they’re not happy with joy, and with cause or reason.
ai-patthana13.7:1.1_6: With the rapture and bliss because of rapture, they don’t arise in those without rapture and bliss because of these things.
ai-patthana13.7:4.1_0: With rapture he doesn’t give rise to pleasure in the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-patthana13.7:4.1_1: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana13.7:6.1_0: You should also ask a question about the same kind of associated with them, and all of them in full awareness.
